Provides a list of dates corresponding to each period of the given time series

Source: R/timeseries.R
daysOf.Rd

Provides a list of dates corresponding to each period of the given time series

Usage

daysOf(ts, pos = 1)

Arguments

ts

A time series

pos

The position of the first considered period.

Value

A list of the starting dates of each period

Examples

daysOf(retail$BookStores)
#>   [1] "1992-01-01" "1992-02-01" "1992-03-01" "1992-04-01" "1992-05-01"
#>   [6] "1992-06-01" "1992-07-01" "1992-08-01" "1992-09-01" "1992-10-01"
#>  [11] "1992-11-01" "1992-12-01" "1993-01-01" "1993-02-01" "1993-03-01"
#>  [16] "1993-04-01" "1993-05-01" "1993-06-01" "1993-07-01" "1993-08-01"
#>  [21] "1993-09-01" "1993-10-01" "1993-11-01" "1993-12-01" "1994-01-01"
#>  [26] "1994-02-01" "1994-03-01" "1994-04-01" "1994-05-01" "1994-06-01"
#>  [31] "1994-07-01" "1994-08-01" "1994-09-01" "1994-10-01" "1994-11-01"
#>  [36] "1994-12-01" "1995-01-01" "1995-02-01" "1995-03-01" "1995-04-01"
